intro: Pterotheca taurica, commonly known as the Tauric pterotheca, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Pterotheca taurica is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and coastal winds.
